column4: I'm having some troubles with Dapper - after upgrading from Hoary to dapper it doesn't find my /dev/hda5 anymore... after adding them manually it does boot, but DMA is off ... and besides having to add them manualy when booting the system is ugly. ;-)
can you take your conversation about dapper to #ubuntu+1
put the contents of the file /etc/fstab in paste.ubuntu-nl.org and give us the URL thank you

1) open a terminal  from the menu - Applicaitons Accessories Terminal 2) in that terminal type the piece between the  <> | >>cat /etc/fstab <<  3) highlight with a mouse (left click) 4) right click and copy and 5) paste it into the window on the page paste.ubuntu-nl.org (hint open the web page first)
i`ve done that..and is still not working...
if you have doen what I have said then reboot and see what the situation is
now is working thank you...but now i want to set up my wireless...that`s why I mounted Windows
read that thing there from ubotu and check out the desktop guide at help.ubuntu.com it is rather good
i`ve tried from there to install my drivers but is not working ...and I have a Dell Card 1370
I don't do wireless I can only suggest what others have written
no it does not you can try anything
hardware can have the same chips inside and different brands outside
all I can point you to is the wiki page https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
